title: LCM Calculator - Least Common Multiple
description: Calculate the Least Common Multiple (LCM) of two or more numbers. Find the smallest number that is a multiple of all given numbers.
formula: (function() { const gcd = (a, b) => b === 0 ? a : gcd(b, a % b); const lcm = (a, b) => Math.abs(a * b) / gcd(a, b); return lcm(Math.abs(Math.round(a)), Math.abs(Math.round(b))); })()
howTo: The result shows the least common multiple of the two numbers

faq.question: What is LCM?
faq.answer: LCM (Least Common Multiple) is the smallest positive integer that is a multiple of two or more numbers. It's useful for finding common denominators in fractions and solving various mathematical problems.

faq.question: How is LCM calculated?
faq.answer: LCM can be calculated using the formula: LCM(a, b) = |a × b| / GCD(a, b), where GCD is the Greatest Common Divisor. This calculator uses this efficient method.

faq.question: What's the relationship between GCD and LCM?
faq.answer: For any two numbers a and b: GCD(a, b) × LCM(a, b) = |a × b|. This relationship allows efficient calculation of one when you know the other.

faq.question: Can I find LCM of more than two numbers?
faq.answer: Yes, you can find LCM of multiple numbers by finding LCM of the first two, then LCM of that result with the third number, and so on.

faq.question: When is LCM used?
faq.answer: LCM is commonly used when adding or subtracting fractions with different denominators, finding common periods in repeating patterns, and solving problems involving multiples.
